questions.text: What song did Sam play to re-energize Carla?
questions.correct: You Know You Make Me Want to Shout
questions.explanation:
You Know You Make Me Want to Shout.

	Playing the song worked and had Carla dancing around. However, she danced over to the jukebox and turned it off telling Sam, "And leave it off."

questions.text: What did Diane say could be very interesting?
questions.explanation:
observing people.

	Diane said it's fun to imagine what people are like by observing them. She gets the gang at Cheers to create a story about a strange man they see at Cheers.

questions.text: What did Woody suggest about the strange man in the bar?
questions.correct: He was a writer or poet.
options: He was from Indiana just like Woody.
questions.explanation:
He was a writer or poet.

	Diane told Woody that his thoughts about the man were good. However, she wanted the gang to dig deeper and try to guess what the man was all about.

questions.text: What did Woody say Hanover, IN was?
options: Drunk driving capital of the world
A really nice place to live
questions.explanation:
Placemat capital of the world.

	There really is a town called Hanover, IN. Woody Harrelson, who played Woody Boyd attended Hanover College where he studied acting. The gang at Cheers often pokes fun at Woody Boyd because he is from this little hick town and doesn't fully grasp big city life.

questions.text: What did Cliff suggest about the strange man?
questions.explanation:
He was with the KGB.

	The KGB was the security police for Russia at one time. Cliff thinks anyone who acts a little bit different than him is a communist, or dangerous (such as one episode in a later season where he thought is neighbor was Adolph Hitler).

questions.text: Where did the gang all go to discuss the strange man?
questions.explanation:
the ladies' room.

	They didn't want to look suspicious so they decide to all go in separately to the ladies' room. However, they all clumped up so it did look weird.

questions.text: Who did Cliff think the strange man was spying on?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	He thought Woody was suspicious because he got hired the first day he walked into Cheers. Woody never has a resume, or a job interview or any of the normal new job things.

questions.text: When did Norm say Cliff last bought a stamp?
questions.explanation:
Johnson Administration.

	One would think he was referring to the Lyndon B. Johnson administration which was November 22, 1963- January 20, 1969. However, Norm tells him he was talking about Andrew Johnson who was president from April 15, 1865- March 4, 1869. That is to say, Cliff had never purchased a stamp.

questions.text: What was the strange man's name?
questions.explanation:
Irving.

	Irving was played by M.C. Gainey. He was born in Mississippi in 1948.

questions.text: What did Frasier say he dreamed of?
questions.explanation:
Tuesday.

	Diane thought the gang at Cheers is going to get her back so she talked to Frasier about it. When she said she needed to talk to him, he thought she wanted to get back together. When he realizes that's not what she wanted he covers it up by saying that he dreamed of Tuesday.
